intro: Triumfetta ryeae subsp. brevipetala, commonly known as the narrow-petaled triumfetta, is a flowering plant native to parts of Africa. It belongs to the family Malvaceae, which includes cotton and hibiscus. The plant is characterized by its small, delicate flowers with five petals and a hairy stem. It typically grows in dry, open habitats such as grasslands and rocky areas. Its leaves are ovate to lanceolate, and it produces small, capsule-like fruits.
